intro: Athamanta annua, commonly known as the annual athamanta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Athamanta annua is native to parts of Africa and is often found in arid and semi-arid regions.
